title: By crushing its own people, the Iranian regime paves the way for its own downfall
subhead: In Iran, every uprising and ensuing deadly crackdown has further eroded the regime's legitimacy, with it being seen as increasingly hostile to its own people, clinging to privileges that have become ever more intolerable.

title: EU-Mercosur deal heralds real but far-off gains for the European industrial sector
The Ukrainian-held Donbas, a land of ruins and grief
Trump signs emergency order to protect US-held revenue from Venezuela oil
subhead: The executive order follows a meeting on Friday at the White House where Trump pressed top oil executives to invest in Venezuela, with the chief executive of ExxonMobil describing the country as 'uninvestable' without sweeping reforms. Chevron is currently the only US firm licensed to operate in Venezuela.

title: Bob Weir, founding member of the Grateful Dead, has died at age 78
subhead: A statement released Saturday on Weir's Instagram page announced that the jam band icon 'transitioned peacefully, surrounded by loved ones, after courageously beating cancer.' Weir’s death leaves drummer Bill Kreutzmann as the only surviving original member.

title: When the damage caused by alcohol begins in utero
subhead: Drinking alcoholic beverages during pregnancy can trigger more or less severe neurodevelopmental and growth disorders. Recent studies also show that fathers' alcohol consumption prior to conception may play a harmful role as well.

title: Christophe Vasseur, baker and restaurateur
subhead: The founder of the hugely popular Du Pain et des Idées bakery in central Paris just opened a welcoming eatery. There, he showcases his mastery of oven baking by offering communal cuisine where large 'mosaic pizzas' take center stage.

title: US announces 'large-scale' strikes against IS in Syria
In Los Angeles, one year after the fires: 'I will only live here if the neighborhood is rebuilt to withstand fire'
Syria's Kurdish fighters agree to leave Aleppo after deadly clashes
Moses with a selfie stick, Goliath at a weightlifting competition: How AI gives the sacred new life
Mexico's president downplays Trump's threats

US oil majors show only moderate enthusiasm for Venezuelan oil, despite Trump's urging
EU Commission considers enacting the EU-Mercosur trade deal before MEPs ratify it
'Don't forget you saved my life': Letter to the stranger who gave me their bone marrow
subhead: Hélène Schlesinger was 37 and had a husband, two children, and plenty of plans for the future when she learned, in 2022, that she had leukemia. For months, the young woman fought as she waited for a bone marrow transplant. She lives thanks to an anonymous donor. All she knows is that he is German and that a part of him now lives inside her.

title: 'In Iran, the conditions that enabled the American operation in Venezuela are not present'
subhead: Political analyst Hamzeh Safavi, whose father is an adviser to Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, discusses the abduction of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro by the US on January 3 in Caracas, and its impact on the Islamic Republic.

title: 'Love Is Blind: France' contestants sue over 'inhuman or degrading treatment' during filming
subhead: Three participants in the French version of Netflix reality TV show have brought their case before a Paris-region labor court, claiming they were deprived of their personal freedoms during the filming of the show.

title: France's narrow path toward a budget
'Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland'
Greenland is and must remain European
